question: 日韓
sourceMnemonic: With the <ja>日</ja> of <ja>日本</ja>, the <ja>日</ja> means <kanji>Japan</kanji>. Then, you add <kanji>Korea</kanji> into the mix and you have Japan + Korea. This word means <vocabulary>Japan and South Korea</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>South Korea and Japan</vocabulary> (depending on where you're from, I guess).
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
